definitions.definition: An enclosed space; a courtyard ; an uncovered area shut in by the walls of a building, or by different buildings; also, a space opening from a street and nearly surrounded by houses; a blind alley .
examples: The girls were playing in the court .

subdefinitions.definition: A street with no outlet, a cul-de-sac .
A housing estate under the Home Ownership Scheme .
subdefinitions.label_groups: Hong Kong , only used in names

subdefinitions.definition: An apartment building , or a small development of several apartment buildings.
subdefinitions.label_groups: Hong Kong , only used in names

subdefinitions.definition: The residence of a sovereign , prince, nobleman, or other dignitary; a palace .
examples: The noblemen visited the queen in her court .

subdefinitions.definition: The collective body of persons composing the retinue of a sovereign or person high in authority; all the surroundings of a sovereign in his regal state.
examples: The queen and her court traveled to the city to welcome back the soldiers.

subdefinitions.definition: Any formal assembling of the retinue of a sovereign.

definitions.definition: Attention directed to a person in power; behaviour designed to gain favor; politeness of manner; civility towards someone.

subdefinitions.definition: The hall , chamber, or place, where justice is administered.
examples: Many famous criminals have been put on trial in this court .

subdefinitions.definition: The persons officially assembled under authority of law , at the appropriate time and place, for the administration of justice ; an official assembly , legally met together for the transaction of judicial business; a judge or judges sitting for the hearing or trial of cases.
examples: The court started proceedings at 11 o'clock.

subdefinitions.definition: An organization for the administration of law, consisting of a body of judges with a certain jurisdiction along with its administrative apparatus.
examples: Each province in Canada has three courts : a provincial court , a superior court , and a court of appeals.

subdefinitions.definition: The judge or judges or other judicial officer presiding in a particular matter, particularly as distinguished from the counsel or jury, or both.
The session of a judicial assembly.
examples: The court is now in session.

subdefinitions.definition: Any jurisdiction , civil, military, or ecclesiastical.

definitions.definition: A place arranged for playing the games of tennis , basketball , handball , badminton , volleyball , squash and some other games
examples: The local sports club has six tennis courts and two squash courts .
The shuttlecock landed outside the court .

subdefinitions.definition: one of the two divisions of a tennis , badminton or volleyball court, in which the player or players of each team play

definitions.definition: A space prepared and decorated by certain bird species in which to advertise themselves for a mate .
examples: The male Wilson's bird of paradise clears an area of rainforest to create a court in which to perform an elaborate mating dance.

main_definition: An enclosed space; a courtyard ; an uncovered area shut in by the walls of a building, or by different buildings; also, a space opening from a street and nearly surrounded by houses; a blind alley .
secondary_definitions: Attention directed to a person in power; behaviour designed to gain favor; politeness of manner; civility towards someone.
( sports ) A place arranged for playing the games of tennis , basketball , handball , badminton , volleyball , squash and some other games
( ornithology ) A space prepared and decorated by certain bird species in which to advertise themselves for a mate .
